title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 23 January 2015 - XWiki
content:

10:06 <cjd> has quit  
10:10 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
10:12 <cjd\_> has joined #xwiki

10:17 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
10:18 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:20 <cjd\_> is now known as <cjd>  
10:38 <tmortagne> has quit  
10:38 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <vmassol> cjd: don't know if you've seen this but couchbase has recently introduced N1QL: http://docs.couchbase.com/developer/n1ql-dp3/n1ql-intro.html  
10:47 <vmassol> (seems interesting for running XWiki on couchbase)  
10:48 <vmassol> (for supporting our queries)  
10:53 <cjd> isn't couchbase more or less dead at this point?  
10:53 <cjd> I thought mongodb killed all of the competition  
10:53 <vmassol> ah no quite the opposite  
10:53 <vmassol> mongo is for poc but not for prod  
10:54 <vmassol> mongo is not scaling basically  
10:54 <cjd> ...and nodejs has not reached 1.0...    but tell that to Walmart and linkedin  
10:54 <cjd> also happy friday  
10:54 <cjd> and paypal  
10:55 <vmassol> I'm in a discussion group discussing mongo and couchbase  
10:55 <vmassol> and everyone seems to agree  
10:55 <vmassol> I don't have first hand experience so I can only say what I hear  
10:55 <vmassol> but these are people i trust  
10:56 <cjd> http://www.googlefight.com/index.php?lang=en\_GB&word1=mongodb&word2=couchdb  
10:56 <cjd> lol that's sad  
10:56 <vmassol> so if I had to choose some nosql and someone suggested mongo I'd verify some stuff  
10:57 <cjd> the cheap answer is to sit it out... mysql still works  
10:57 <vmassol> errr… aren't doing research? :)  
10:57 <vmassol> \*you  
10:57 <cjd> http://www.googlefight.com/index.php?lang=en\_GB&word1=mongodb&word2=couchbase  
10:58 <cjd> yeah, researching how risky an open source project is  
10:58 <vmassol> ok you're missing my point, sorry for wasting your time  
10:58 <vmassol> was just trying to help you actually  
10:58 <cjd> woah it's written in erlang  
10:58 <cjd> thanks :)  
10:59 <vmassol> (because I know you had taken an interest in nosql and xwiki at some point)  
10:59 <cjd> it's interesting in theory but nosql is so new that there's a massive risk of backing the wrong horse  
11:00 <cjd> IMO one solution will come out the winner and all of the others will end up in the dust  
11:01 <vmassol> Look at RDBMS there's no single winner  
11:01 <cjd> good point.. but they all talk the same basic language  
11:01 <vmassol> and xwiki has to supports 3-5 RDBMS  
11:02 <vmassol> (as a consequence)  
11:02 <cjd> the winner was SQL  
11:03 <cjd> as I understand, before IBM and Oracle pushed SQL, there were many different DB designs. Then they all died except SQL, my opinion is we're in that pre-SQL period again  
11:10 <Inge-> SQL works well in a LOT of cases - AND we generally understand their limitations.  
11:11 <gsmeria> has quit  
11:11 <Inge-> NoSQL works \*GREAT\* in some cases, but we are more easily blindsided by the areas they don't work so well in - and as many learned with MongoDB, there is much we don't know yet that can bite us  
11:11 <Inge-> I like Redis :D  
11:12 <cjd> +1 to all 3  
11:13 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
11:21 <tmortagne> Enygma`: so you still want to take care of http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6058 for 7.0 ? I will have to work in this area at some point (related to async display of panel, macros, etc.) so I might have to look at it anyway (but not now). But better break something in x.0 than later  
11:23 <vmassol> thanks msmeria  
11:23 <msmeria> vmassol: you're welcome :)  
11:31 <tmortagne> mflorea: any idea when XWikiDocument#getRenderedContent started using displayer module ?  
11:31 <vmassol> tmortagne: isn't this going to cause us some perf issue on the medium term: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/RamonaConoro?viewer=changes&rev2=3.156  
11:31 <vmassol> ?  
11:32 <mflorea> tmortagne: I did it. let me check jira  
11:32 <tmortagne> vmassol: it cause watchlist performances issues but this field is actually quite limited because of XWIKI-7339  
11:33 <lucaa> has quit  
11:34 <mflorea> tmortagne: I think it's this https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/aca51893724cb5203e5c7f5cbecdd62d91ec0a1c  
11:34 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
11:34 <tmortagne> the commit log sounds like it indeed, no related issue ?  
11:35 <tmortagne> I would like to close an issue that was actually fixed by this change  
11:35 <tmortagne> XWIKI-6054  
11:36 <tmortagne> I was looking at it and saw that the document displayer was using XWikiDocument#getXDOM  
11:36 <mflorea> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-6971  
11:36 <tmortagne> thanks  
11:45 <lyes1> has joined #xwiki  
11:46 <lyes> has quit  
11:55 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
11:55 <Enygma`> tmortagne: go ahead  
11:56 <Enygma`> I`m clearly +1 for breaking it in 7.x as long as we fill the huge security problem  
11:57 <tmortagne> ok

12:23 <fmancinelli> In the trend of SQL/noSQL I've read that a very good candidate is Postgres which starts to very well support both of the two worlds with its JSON and JSONB data types. About Mongo, besides the horror stories, I've read that's indeed losing wrt the competition.  
12:26 <cjd> I like postgres, it does everything :)  
12:26 <cjd> killer analytics platform  
12:33 <DarkKnightCZ2> has quit  
12:34 <gsmeria> has quit  
12:40 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki

13:32 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki

13:35 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
14:32 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:47 <RamonaConoro> has joined #xwiki  
14:58 <msmeria> has quit  
15:16 <ClemensR> if I install the 6.4 in the jetty-hsql variant and try to install "Filter Confluence XML module" the EM tells me "Error: This version is not compatible with your installation." despite of being 6.4  
15:16 <ClemensR> how can I figure out what is not compatible ?  
15:17 <ClemensR> ah, it is in the install log ... sorry for the noise :(  
15:30 <tmortagne> what the detail tells you on why it fail to install it ?  
15:31 <tmortagne> ClemensR:  
15:32 <ClemensR> it is a conflict in the commons-compress 1.9 vs 1.8.1  
15:32 <ClemensR> one moment,. need to retry  
15:32 <tmortagne> "(Error: This version is not compatible with your installation." is a new "shorcut"  error when version incompatibility is found in the log)  
15:32 <tmortagne> hmm that's weird  
15:33 <tmortagne> you mean we have 1.8.1 in XE 6.4 ?  
15:33 <tmortagne> that would be a bug  
15:33 <tmortagne> unless some jar embedd commons-compress and misslead the core extension scanner which would not be great either  
15:34 <tmortagne> as far as I can see XE 6.4 WAR has commons-compress-1.9, lets see what core extensions are saying  
15:36 <ClemensR> yes, indeed it has commons-compress-1.9.jar  in the WEB-INF/lib  
15:36 <ClemensR> actually want to test something else, so I "installed" the jar manually ... need to undo that  
15:37 <tmortagne> ok I was about to say "hmm we I look at core extension in EM I see commons-compress 1.9"  
15:37 <tmortagne> so you had both 1.8.1 and 1.9 or you removed 1.9 ?  
15:39 <ClemensR> no, I did not remove anything, the 1.9 seems to have been tehre from the start  
15:40 <tlx45> @ClemensR - have you have a chance to look at that PDF issue from yesterday?  
15:40 <tmortagne> ok so the scanner took one randomly, maybe I should improve that a bit to make it select the most recent one (but in practice its going to be pretty random in the classloader)  
15:40 <ClemensR> I wonder why the "Confluence XML module" want something different .... not restarting after manual remove ..  
15:41 <ClemensR> tlx45: sorry, did not update my chome yet, and cannot reproduce with the 35.0-version  
15:41 <tmortagne> Confluence XML module expect what is in xwiki-common root pom  
15:41 <tmortagne> so not something different  
15:41 <tmortagne> but since you had 1.8.1 that's what the core extension scanner found  
15:44 <ClemensR> yeah, it sais:  "Dependency [org.apache.commons:commons-compress-1.9] is not compatible  with core extension [org.apache.commons:commons-compress-1.8.1]    " ... not sure why it finds 1.8.1  
15:44 <tmortagne> because you have it in WEB\_INF/lib  
15:45 <ClemensR> there is only webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/commons-compress-1.9.jar  
15:45 <tmortagne> you used to have both as you said  
15:45 <tmortagne> if you don't restart nothing change  
15:45 <ClemensR> but in EM it sais I have "Apache Commons Compress         1.8.1"  as "core extension"  
15:45 <ClemensR> yes, I have restarted  
15:45 <tmortagne> I have 1.9 when I look in core extension  
15:46 <tmortagne> are you really sure you removed it and not just renamed ?  
15:46 <tmortagne> (and the install work well for me)  
15:48 <ClemensR> ok, seems to be a bad glitch from de- and re-installing things.  Only mention of commons-compress-1.8.1  is from a  data/cache/extension/core/\*.xed  
15:49 <ClemensR> will start over with a fresh install, just wanted to testing some conflience->XWiki  import anyway  
15:50 <tmortagne> it keep what it found in a cache to not re-resolve it but the cache key is the file name so it should not take into account that cache  
15:50 <tmortagne> ClemensR: could you keep that cache  
15:50 <tmortagne> I would like to try to reproduce your issue  
15:50 <ClemensR> ah too late :(  
15:50 <tmortagne> it's ok I can probably reproduce by putting the jar in WEB-INF/lib anyway  
15:50 <ClemensR> well, unzipping a fresh 6.4 and trying to reproduce ...  
15:51 <vrachieru> has quit  
15:56 <tmortagne> ClemensR: I cannot reproduce, no idea why it kept 1.8.1 in core extensions for you  
15:57 <ClemensR> yes, must be because its Friday and system want to persuade be to stop working ;)  
15:57 <tmortagne> :)  
15:57 <tmortagne> it could have been some bug in my very young core extension cache  
15:57 <ClemensR> I might come around with another problem with the confluence import soon, but will first try to reproduce a second time ...  
15:57 <tmortagne> ok  
15:58 <vmassol> ClemensR: strange, in my case XWiki is always trying to convince me to work over the week end ;)  
15:58 <ClemensR> maybe it is because you write the better code :D  
15:59 <vmassol> well right now I'm trying to make my code pass the tests...  
15:59 <ClemensR> tmortagne: strange, it is back for me  
16:00 <tmortagne> a pity the UI does not display the file associated to teh core extension, let me give you some velocity snippet to check something  
16:00 <ClemensR> should I sent you the complete data/cache/extension/core/  by mail, or is it just the file saying it should be  commons-compress-1.8.1  
16:00 <ClemensR> ah, ok, standing by for snippet  
16:01 <ClemensR> maybe I have something "special"  in my $HOME/.m2/repository  breaking things  
16:04 <cjd> mv ~/.m2/repository ~/\_m2\_repository.bak  
16:05 <cjd> mvn clean install &  go\_get\_a\_coffee;  
16:05 <tmortagne> ClemensR: core extension are classpath jars, nothing to do with any external repository  
16:06 <ClemensR> yeah, that is that I thought, too, but I can reproduce the issue from a fresh jetty-hsql-6.4, just after unzipping  
16:06 <ClemensR> cjd: ClemensR throws TooMuchCoffeeException ;)  
16:06 <tmortagne> ClemensR: $services.component.getInstance("org.xwiki.extension.repository.CoreExtensionRepository").getCoreExtension("org.apache.commons:commons-compress").getFile().getURL()  
16:07 <tmortagne> should give you the jar XWiki think is commons-compress  
16:07 <tmortagne> it's possible some jar embbed commons-compress 1.8.1 pom.xml and it's visible only randomly  
16:07 <ClemensR> file:/path/to/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-6.4/webapps/xwiki/WEB-INF/lib/jython-standalone-2.7-b3-xwiki-1.jar  
16:08 <tmortagne> crap  
16:08 <tmortagne> of course jython  
16:08 <tmortagne> looks like i did not cleaned it enough  
16:08 <tmortagne> jython produce really bad jar  
16:09 <ClemensR> strange that it does not happen for everybody. just got a report from some folks having installed the confluence XML filter on 6.4 and complained that it does not do anything ... so they have been able to install it, seemingly  
16:10 <tmortagne> I don't understand how I did to forget to remove this file, that's the first reason why I repackage jython jar...  
16:12 <ClemensR> looks like a schreodinbug  
16:13 <tmortagne> I think I cleaned the jar and deployed... the standard one  
16:14 <tmortagne> still it's weird that our deduplication check in XE WAR did not catched it  
16:14 <tmortagne> ha no it's not the in the same place since it's not the same version  
16:14 <tmortagne> and jython does not relaly contain commons-compress, just its pom  
16:24 <ClemensR> well, now that I copied the  org.xwiki.platform\_xwiki-platform-filter-stream-confluencexml-6.4.jar manually into WEB-INF/lib it lists the "(conflience+xml)" format in the Filter UI, but fails to looks up the org.xwiki.filter.confluence.xml.internal.input.ConfluenceInputFilterStream component ....  
16:25 <tmortagne> ClemensR: because you are missing the syntax parser I think, you can use the new jython jar I deployed  
16:25 <ClemensR> nut that is probably because I have botched up something ...  
16:25 <ClemensR> ok, retrying ....  
16:25 <tmortagne> http://maven.xwiki.org/externals/org/python/jython-standalone/2.7-b3-xwiki-2/  
16:26 <ClemensR> ah, thanks for the link  
16:27 <tmortagne> should always get the right commons-compress with that  
16:32 <woshilapin> Hi devs, I'm having problem to compile XWiki v6.4, it seems that I have problem on Downloading: http://repo.maven.apache.org/maven2/org/xwiki/commons/xwiki-commons/6.4/xwiki-commons-6.4.pom  
16:32 <woshilapin> Any idea?  
16:32 <ClemensR> tmortagne: thanks, that fixed it!  
16:33 <tmortagne> ClemensR: ok  
16:33 <ClemensR> woshilapin:  you might need to update your settings.xml  
16:33 <woshilapin> Something changed in settings.xml since the last versions?  
16:33 <tmortagne> commons is supposed to be on central so that's weird  
16:33 <woshilapin> https://ezcrypt.it/Z5An#c3fIsui2ISvNZzGJNJnqPkKj  
16:33 <tmortagne> did you tied several times ?  
16:33 <tmortagne> tried  
16:33 <woshilapin> Here is a complete log of Maven  
16:33 <woshilapin> Yes  
16:34 <tmortagne> hmm  
16:34 <woshilapin> And Travis did also for me :-)  
16:34 <tmortagne> vmassol: did you pushed 6.4 on central ?  
16:34 <woshilapin> OK, it seems that it crashed a lot on commons but not always, indeed  
16:34 <vmassol> ah I forgot to close the repos  
16:34 <vmassol> I published the artifacts but forgot to promote  
16:34 <vmassol> doing it  
16:35 <woshilapin> Why sometimes it works, sometimes not?  
16:35 <woshilapin> (Because it's a pain for continuous integration, using Travis-CI on my side on research projects)  
16:36 <ClemensR> I guess as soon as you (it travis) have it in your local maven repo, the world can fall apart without you noticing it, but if it is gone once, desaster strikes unexpectedly  
16:37 <woshilapin> Yes, that's the part I understand  
16:38 <woshilapin> But it seems that Maven is not trying hard to get the dependencies downloaded and when it fails on one dependency, it don't try a second time and crash your build  
16:38 <woshilapin> When you have a temporary fail on a download, then...  
16:38 <woshilapin> It's OK, you can relaunch  
16:39 <woshilapin> But in the case of CI, it download everything each time, it increases the probability to fail  
16:39 <woshilapin> (at least, that's what I understood but maybe I'm completely wrong :-\ )  
16:40 <tmortagne> has quit  
16:41 <vmassol> should be ok now for maven central  
16:42 <ClemensR> I thought the CI caches some maven repos, too (?) anyay I somethimes notive that if the XWiki verison changes, sometimes I need to rebuild twice because the first one fails with dependency issues. But I have to admit I never tried tofigure out why this is the case  
16:44 <woshilapin> OK  
16:45 <woshilapin> vmassol: Thanks :-)  
16:45 <vmassol> yw  
16:45 <woshilapin> Indeed, Travis doesn't complain anymore :-)  
16:45 <vmassol> cool :)
